Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> Or start all over?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> basically do an airdrop to a new chain like Hush did

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> keep all balances

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> but wipe all transaction history

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> start fresh with transaction history and UTXO set

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> but give people same balances to same addresses

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> that way, no backward compatability to old transaction types is necessary

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> this is why Hush does not need to support *anything* Sprout related

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Pirate still has sprout code to deal with old sprout transactions. It's just disabled in new transactions

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> so when you sync Pirate, the first few months of Sprout xtns take much more CPU, and require the 1.6GB download

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> once you get past those, it's just Sapling stuff, only 50MB of downloads for those

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> but since they are in the history, it's not simple for Pirate to do what Hush did. They can do something similar, but have to choose between a few different technical choices

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
